comment.author: 13935339@N05
comment._content:
The upper image is Burgess' rendition of the Boeing XF8B-1, the company's final attempt at a Navy fighter design. 

He was obviously very taken with the aesthetics of the "Shooting Star," as he painted it over a dozen times in this collection. Here, he paints both YP-80As at the north Pole (although neither, to my knowledge, ever deployed to Alaska for cold weather testing).

Under Project EXTRAVERSION, YP-80As serial 44-83028. and 44-83029 had been deployed to Italy in the closing months of the war for operational testing - NO COMBAT. two birds had also been sent to the UK under the same program (44-83026 & -027), but both were destroyed in fatal crashes...
